Condition.Diagnostic: Select Data/Address in the Pinout view.

RefParameter.Name: NandPageSize1
RefParameter.Description: NAND memory page size (without spare area) measured in bytes for 8-bit addressing or words for 16-bit addressing.

RefParameter.Name: NandSpareAreaSize1
RefParameter.Description: NAND memory spare area size measured in bytes for 8-bit addressing or words for 16-bit addressing.

RefParameter.Name: NandBlockSize1
RefParameter.Description: NAND memory block size expressed in number of pages.

RefParameter.Name: NandBlockNbr1
RefParameter.Description: NAND memory number of blocks.

RefParameter.Name: NandPlaneNbr1
RefParameter.Description: NAND memory number of planes.

RefParameter.Name: NandPlaneSize1
RefParameter.Description: NAND memory plane size measured in number of blocks.

RefParameter.Name: NandExtraCommandEnable1
RefParameter.Description: NAND extra command needed for page reading mode. This parameter is mandatory for some NAND memories. Please check the read mode sequence in the NAND device datasheet.

Condition.Diagnostic: To disable the wait feature, switch to the Pinout view and disable the corresponding NAND 1 wait mode.
To enable the wait feature, switch to the Pinout view and enable the corresponding NAND 1 wait mode.

RefParameter.Comment: CLE low to RE low delay in HCLK cycles
RefParameter.Name: TCLRSetupTime1

RefParameter.Comment: ALE low to RE low delay in HCLK cycles
RefParameter.Name: TARSetupTime1
CommonSpaceSetupTime1
RefParameter.Group: NAND common space timing in HCLK cycles

RefParameter.Name: CommonSpaceWaitSetupTime1
RefParameter.Group: NAND common space timing in HCLK cycles

RefParameter.Name: CommonSpaceHoldSetupTime1
RefParameter.Group: NAND common space timing in HCLK cycles

RefParameter.Name: CommonSpaceHiZSetupTime1
RefParameter.Group: NAND common space timing in HCLK cycles

RefParameter.Name: AttributeSpaceSetupTime1
RefParameter.Group: NAND attribute space timing in HCLK cycles

RefParameter.Name: AttributeSpaceWaitSetupTime1
RefParameter.Group: NAND attribute space timing in HCLK cycles

RefParameter.Group: NAND attribute space timing in HCLK cycles

RefParameter.Name: AttributeSpaceHiZSetupTime1
RefParameter.Group: NAND attribute space timing in HCLK cycles

Condition.Diagnostic: Select Data in the Pinout view.
Select Address in the Pinout view.
Select Address in the Pinout view.
Select Internal bank number in the Pinout view.

RefParameter.Name: CASLatency1
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the SDRAM Column Access Strobe (CAS) latency in number of memory clock cycles.

RefParameter.Name: SDClockPeriod1
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the SDRAM clock period for both SDRAM banks and allows disabling the clock before changing the frequency. In this case the SDRAM must be re-initialized.
The corresponding bits in the FMC_SDCR2 register are read only.

RefParameter.Name: ReadBurst1
RefParameter.Description:
Enables burst read mode. The SDRAM controller anticipates the next read commands during the CAS latency and stores data in the Read FIFO.
The corresponding bit in the FMC_SDCR2 register is don't care.

RefParameter.Name: ReadPipeDelay1
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the delay, in HCLK clock cycles, for reading data after CAS latency.
The corresponding bits in the FMC_SDCR2 register are read only.

RefParameter.Comment: Load mode register to active delay
RefParameter.Name: LoadToActiveDelay1
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the delay between a Load Mode Register command and an Active or Refresh command in number of memory clock cycles.
If two SDRAM devices are connected, all the accesses performed simultaneously to both devices by the Command Mode register (Load Mode Register command) are issued using the timing parameters configured for Bank 1 (TMRD (Load mode register to active delay) and TRAS (Self-refresh time) timings) in the FMC_SDTR1 register.
The TRP (Row precharge delay) and TRC (Row cycle delay) timings are only configured in the FMC_SDTR1 register. If two SDRAM devices are used, the TRP and TRC timings must be programmed with the timings of the slowest device.

RefParameter.Name: ExitSelfRefreshDelay1
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the delay from releasing the Self-refresh command to issuing the Activate command in number of memory clock cycles.
If two SDRAM devices are used, the FMC_SDTR1 and FMC_SDTR2 registers must be programmed with the same Exit Self-refresh Delay corresponding to the slowest SDRAM device.

RefParameter.Name: SelfRefreshTime1
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the minimum Self-refresh period in number of memory clock cycles.

RefParameter.Name: RowCycleDelay1
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the delay between the Refresh command and the Activate command, as well as the delay between two consecutive Refresh commands.
It is expressed in number of memory clock cycles.
The Row Cycle Delay is only configured in the FMC_SDTR1 register. If two SDRAM devices are used, the Row Cycle Delay must be programmed with the timings of the slowest device.

RefParameter.Name: WriteRecoveryTime1
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the delay between a Write and a Precharge command in number of memory clock cycles.
WriteRecoveryTime must satisfy the following constraints:
1: WriteRecoveryTime >= SelfRefreshTime - RowToColumnDelay,
2: WriteRecoveryTime >= RowCycleDelay - RowToColumnDelay - RowPrechargeDelay.
If two SDRAM devices are used, the FMC_SDTR1 and FMC_SDTR2 registers must be programmed with the same Write Recovery Time corresponding to the slowest SDRAM device.

RefParameter.Name: RPDelay1
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the delay between a Precharge command and another command in number of memory clock cycles.
The Row Precharge Delay is only configured in the FMC_SDTR1 register. If two SDRAM devices are used, the Row Precharge Delay must be programmed with the timing of the slowest device.

RefParameter.Name: RCDDelay1
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the delay between the Activate command and a Read/Write command in number of memory clock cycles.

Condition.Diagnostic: Select Data in the Pinout view.
Select Address in the Pinout view.
Select Address in the Pinout view.
Select Internal bank number in the Pinout view.

RefParameter.Name: CASLatency2
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the SDRAM Column Access Strobe (CAS) latency in number of memory clock cycles.

RefParameter.Name: SDClockPeriod2
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the SDRAM clock period for both SDRAM banks and allows disabling the clock before changing the frequency. In this case the SDRAM must be re-initialized.
The corresponding bits in the FMC_SDCR2 register are read only.

RefParameter.Name: ReadBurst2
RefParameter.Description:
Enables burst read mode. The SDRAM controller anticipates the next read commands during the CAS latency and stores data in the Read FIFO.
The corresponding bit in the FMC_SDCR2 register is don't care.

RefParameter.Name: ReadPipeDelay2
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the delay, in HCLK clock cycles, for reading data after CAS latency.
The corresponding bits in the FMC_SDCR2 register are read only.

RefParameter.Comment: Load mode register to active delay
RefParameter.Name: LoadToActiveDelay2
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the delay between a Load Mode Register command and an Active or Refresh command in number of memory clock cycles.
If two SDRAM devices are connected, all the accesses performed simultaneously to both devices by the Command Mode register (Load Mode Register command) are issued using the timing parameters configured for Bank 1 (TMRD (Load mode register to active delay) and TRAS (Self-refresh time) timings) in the FMC_SDTR1 register.
The TRP (Row precharge delay) and TRC (Row cycle delay) timings are only configured in the FMC_SDTR1 register. If two SDRAM devices are used, the TRP and TRC timings must be programmed with the timings of the slowest device.

RefParameter.Name: ExitSelfRefreshDelay2
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the delay from releasing the Self-refresh command to issuing the Activate command in number of memory clock cycles.
If two SDRAM devices are used, the FMC_SDTR1 and FMC_SDTR2 registers must be programmed with the same Exit Self-refresh Delay corresponding to the slowest SDRAM device.

RefParameter.Name: SelfRefreshTime2
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the minimum Self-refresh period in number of memory clock cycles.

RefParameter.Name: RowCycleDelay2
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the delay between the Refresh command and the Activate command, as well as the delay between two consecutive Refresh commands.
It is expressed in number of memory clock cycles.
The Row Cycle Delay is only configured in the FMC_SDTR1 register. If two SDRAM devices are used, the Row Cycle Delay must be programmed with the timings of the slowest device.

RefParameter.Name: WriteRecoveryTime2
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the delay between a Write and a Precharge command in number of memory clock cycles.
WriteRecoveryTime must satisfy the following constraints:
1: WriteRecoveryTime >= SelfRefreshTime - RowToColumnDelay,
2: WriteRecoveryTime >= RowCycleDelay - RowToColumnDelay - RowPrechargeDelay.
If two SDRAM devices are used, the FMC_SDTR1 and FMC_SDTR2 registers must be programmed with the same Write Recovery Time corresponding to the slowest SDRAM device.

RefParameter.Name: RPDelay2
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description:
Specifies the delay between a Precharge command and another command in number of memory clock cycles.
The Row Precharge Delay is only configured in the FMC_SDTR1 register. If two SDRAM devices are used, the Row Precharge Delay must be programmed with the timing of the slowest device.

RefParameter.Name: RCDDelay2
RefParameter.Group: SDRAM timing in memory clock cycles
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the delay between the Activate command and a Read/Write command in number of memory clock cycles.

Only for PSRAM with either asynchronous read and synchronous write accesses or synchronous read and asynchronous write accesses
Only for NOR Flash, PSRAM and SRAM

Only for NOR Flash, PSRAM and SRAM
